channel.title: This section is a waste of space, coders don't care
channel.description:
Campaigns to put up an official rsc server, doesn't even get into the beta stage.
Coders seem to show no concern that this server flopped. Find someone capable of actually pulling this off, or remove this section.
A nice alternative (although I doubt it will happen) would be to find someone capable and willing to put out a legit, official server for moparscape.

item.title: This section is a waste of space, coders don't care
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

The answer is in the topic title. It’s nowhere. It won’t progress, ever.

Read full topic

item.title: This section is a waste of space, coders don't care
item.dc:creator: @Stealmojo Stealmojo
item.description:
@Stealmojo wrote:

[quote=“JUMPHIM, post:12, topic:547045”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=665944.msg4455802#msg4455802 date=1414799522]
Introducing 3 hit mechanics to RS2 isn’t all that hard. You just apply the various rules that exist in RSC - so no running while in combat until the third damage is dealt, and all weapons have the same speed.

I think it would make for a pretty ordinary style of gameplay still.
[/quote]
do this if its good ill invest in you!![/quote]
All for it

Read full topic

item.source: This section is a waste of space, coders don't care

item.title: This section is a waste of space, coders don't care
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

Rodgerwilco:

[quote]Campaigns to put up an official rsc server, doesn’t even get into the beta stage.

Beta server was up for over a year. Then I threw up another one for a month to check things out. Hmm?

Coders seem to show no concern that this server flopped. Find someone capable of actually pulling this off, or remove this section.

No. The players really aren’t there. We were offering a server with terms no other server can possibly reach (being free, not taking money, open sourced) etc etc and then Kryptix died. xEnt started MoparClassic (due to the how the community was and is) and then when Kryptix died everyone ran to ProjectRSC because they could all take a stab at being head honcho, where is that now?

A nice alternative (although I doubt it will happen) would be to find someone capable and willing to put out a legit, official server for moparscape.

I really don’t agree with this either, it appears that maybe the players need to be interested in change before this will occur.

You’re more than welcome in hosting the server. Everything is publicly available.[/quote]
The players would have been there, if it(as a whole) hadn’t failed so miserably.

EDIT: What I mean by this is that the server might have been up for a year, but no real work was done at any point and the staff team was questionable.

Read full topic
item.source: This section is a waste of space, coders don't care

item.title: This section is a waste of space, coders don't care
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Campaigns to put up an official rsc server, doesn't even get into the beta stage.
Beta server was up for over a year. Then I threw up another one for a month to check things out. Hmm?
Coders seem to show no concern that this server flopped. Find someone capable of actually pulling this off, or remove this section.
No. The players really aren't there. We were offering a server with terms no other server can possibly reach (being free, not taking money, open sourced) etc etc and then Kryptix died. xEnt started MoparClassic (due to the how the community was and is) and then when Kryptix died everyone ran to ProjectRSC because they could all take a stab at being head honcho, where is that now?
A nice alternative (although I doubt it will happen) would be to find someone capable and willing to put out a legit, official server for moparscape.
I really don't agree with this either, it appears that maybe the players need to be interested in change before this will occur. :)

You’re more than welcome in hosting the server. Everything is publicly available.

Read full topic
